action.action-desc: Mr. Roskam introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To impose a moratorium on conferences held by the Internal Revenue Service.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Playing on Citizen’s Cash Act.
The Internal Revenue Service shall not hold any conference until—

paragraph.text: the Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration submits a report to Congress—

subparagraph.text: certifying that the Internal Revenue Service has implemented all of the recommendations set out in such Inspector General’s report titled Review of the August 2010 Small Business/Self-Employed Division’s Conference in Anaheim, California, and

paragraph.text: the Internal Revenue Service is authorized by law (enacted after the date of the enactment of this Act) to resume holding conferences.
